results.title: Here’s How People In India Are Manipulating Twitter Trends To Spread Political Propaganda
results.description: A BuzzFeed News analysis found that at least 10 political hashtags that appeared in the top 10 in Twitter’s trends column in India during the last two months were the result of organized campaigns.

results.title: The Philippines President Serenaded Trump With A Love Song, After He Ordered Him To Sing It
results.description: Rodrigo Duterte said he sang the ballad "upon the orders of the commander in chief of the United States."

results.title: Trump Had The Most Awkward Handshake Ever (Believe Me) And The Photos Are Amazing
results.description: The epitome of "shook."

results.title: These Images From The Earthquake's Aftermath In Iran Will Break Your Heart
results.description: More than 300 people have been killed after a powerful earthquake struck an area along the Iran–Iraq border on Sunday.

results.title: Videos Show UHS Hospital Staff Assaulting Young Patients
results.description: It was supposed to be a refuge for troubled adolescents and foster kids who had run out of other options. But at Hill Crest Behavioral Health — part of UHS, America's largest psychiatric hospital chain — a culture of violence flourished. Internal videos show staff members beating and dragging their young patients. And many say the worst abuses happened beyond any camera’s view. A BuzzFeed News investigation.

results.title: Offensive Tweet About President Obama From Texas College Republicans...Again
results.description: This showed up two days ago on the Twitter feed of the president of the University of Texas College Republicans. She has neither confirmed nor denied she wrote it, but her account was switched to protected shortly after this was posted. The kicker is that the previous president of the University of Texas College Republicans was forced out due to a similarly offensive tweet. History retweets itself, y'all.

results.title: Google Maps Has A "Lord Of The Rings" Easter Egg
results.description: Google is always there to help you. Or at least until they enslave us all, but for now, they just want to make sure you understand the danger of your journey.

results.title: Mitt Romney Does The Top 10 On Letterman
results.description: It's Mitt-tacular. Meaning stiff and slightly awkward. Despite his inert delivery, the jokes are still pretty funny.

results.title: The Dumbest Democratic Quotes Of 2011
results.description: Democrats said some dumb things this year. Here were the moments that stood out.

results.title: The Dumbest Republican Quotes Of 2011
results.description: These are the dumbest things to cross GOP lips this year.

results.title: "Actual" Titles That Foreign Leaders Gave To Kim Jong-Il
results.description: The recently departed "Dear Leader" was called many things in his life. The following are allegedly all titles that were ascribed to him by foreign leaders (according to North Korea).

results.title: Newt Gingrich Called Very Bad Name By Voter In Iowa
results.description: And it was directly to his face. That's Tom Sorensen of Iowa City, and he is not fond of the former Speaker. If you must know, the insult rhymes with "fucking asshole."

results.title: NewtGingrich.com Shows The Politician's Most Embarrassing Moments
results.description: If you attempted to visit NewtGingrich.com today, you might have expected to find the Presidential candidate's home page. But it turns out Gingrich never registered that domain (he has Newt.org), so going to it redirects you to one of a number of sites that bring up the lowlights of the politician's career. We put together a video to demonstrate the clever attack.

results.title: Skyrim Theme Makes For Epic Christmas Light Display
results.description: And the award for best use of music in a Christmas lights display goes to...

results.title: Ron Paul Walks Out Of Interview About Racist Newsletters
results.description: Awkward. Ron Paul really doesn't like talking about the outrageously offensive newsletters he funded, published and profited from (but denies reading, writing or remembering).

results.title: CIA Officer Joins NSC Staff As Agency Vows To Be More "Vicious"
results.description: Michael Barry once worked on a CIA assassination program that had been contracted out to controversial security contractor Erik Prince, founder of Blackwater.

results.title: Happy Holidays From Stefon And The Obamas
results.description: Mr. President, resist the temptation to ask Stefon what "reindeering" is.

results.title: Hack Your Facebook Timeline Cover Art
results.description: Facebook's timeline is finally live for everyone! And you can make the most of it by getting all creative and stuff with your profile photo. Here are a few examples to get you thinking. Upload your own in the comments if you make one!

results.title: "Get Your Censor On," Comic Strips Everyone Should See
results.description: Brilliant cartoonist David Rees has stepped up in an awesome way with "Get Your Censor On." You should read them. Why? Because SOPA would be disastrous for the Internet as we know it.

results.title: Google's "Let It Snow" Easter Egg
results.description: Googling the phrase "let it snow" causes Google to turn your browser window into a winter wonderland. I know Google's unofficial motto is "don't be evil," but I feel like it should be "create awesome easter eggs."

results.title: BuzzFeed Lands Brilliant, Obsessed Political Video Wunderkind
results.description: We're so happy to have Andrew Kaczynski joining the team. Here he is talking to Howard Kurtz on CNN's Reliable Sources about how he digs up the hidden gem videos everyone has been talking about.

results.title: North Korea Turns Out Lights To Honor Kim Jong-Il
results.description: A new Department Of Defense satellite image shows lights out across the country. A fitting memorial.

results.title: Kim Jong-Il Through The Years
results.description: South Korea's Yonhap News Agency is reporting that the North Korean dictator died of fatigue yesterday morning during a 17 hour train ride. This is his life in images.

results.title: North Korean State TV Announces Kim Jong-Il's Death
results.description: You don't need to speak Korean to follow along. Though it might help to know sign language.

results.title: Kim Jong-Il's "Feminine" Son Wrote A Poem About Getting Rid Of Nukes
results.description: Kim Jong-Il deemed his second son, Kim Jong Chol, "too feminine" to take power. This poem that Jong Chol wrote (under the pseudonym Chol Pak) entitled "My Ideal World" might have something to do with that.

results.title: Joe Biden Says The Taliban Is Not Our Enemy
results.description: In an interview with Newsweek/The Daily Beast, Vice President Biden had some interesting things to say about the Taliban and the United States' continuing efforts to bring stability to the region.

results.title: Meet Kim Jong-Il's Sons
results.description: With Kim Jong-Il's passing, we take a look at the three sons he fathered, and why the youngest is taking the reigns.

results.title: Mitt Romney's New Business Venture
results.description: Mitt Romney made millions with Bain Capital, and The Dark Knight Rises is poised to dominate the box office next year, therefore...

results.title: Mr. Dictator Heads
results.description: Create your own dictator, or mix and match your own! Makes a great toy for the single-party or military-junta obsessed kid in your life. Developed by an Australian artist named Stephen Ives.

results.title: BuzzFeed Exclusive: The Santorum-Gingrich Love Fest (With Slightly Less Love On Santorum's Side)
results.description: Newt Gingrich praised Iowa almost-winner Rick Santorum today, saying he's running a "good, positive campaign." In a brief exchange with BuzzFeed this evening, Santorum didn't rule out the possibility of working with Gingrich to defeat favorite Mitt Romney, though he didn't sound too enthusiastic.

results.title: Obama Is The Winner In Today's Caucuses, His Pollster Tells BuzzFeed
results.description: Which is why Romney would like primary season to end tonight.

results.title: Ron Paul Has Unusual Views On Many Issues
results.description: Not just marijuana and the Fed!

results.title: My Night At Michele Bachmann's Headquarters
results.description: Ever wonder what it looks like inside Michele Bachmann's Iowa headquarters? Well, I found out for you. Here are some of my pictures and things I noticed.

results.title: How Michele Bachmann Is Like Tim Tebow
results.description: A group supporting her makes the case in this ad. "No baggage, Christian, and like Tebow, she keeps fighting and keeps winning votes."

results.title: Six Essential Tweets Of Caucus Eve
results.description: Political twitter becomes a firehose on nights like last night. Here's some of what you missed.

results.title: Who's Writing Rupert Murdoch's Tweets?
results.description: Maybe somebody whose first language isn't English? Read the tweets below and see if you agree with Murdoch chronicler Gabriel Sherman, who speculated last night that Murdoch's Chinese-born wife, Wendi Deng Murdoch, is typing up the tweets for a mogul who only recently learned to use email.

results.title: Who Is Writing Rupert Murdoch's Tweets?
results.description:
Maybe somebody whose first language isn't English? Read the tweets below and see if you agree with Murdoch chronicler Gabriel Sherman, who speculated last night that Murdoch's Chinese-born wife, Wendi Deng, is typing up the tweets for a mogul who only recently learned to use email. 
Happy 2012. May itbe better than all experts predict.Has to be!Must change everything to create jobs for all, especiallyyoung— Rupert Murdoch(@rupertmurdoch) January 1, 2012
Good to see santorum surging in Iowa. Regardless of policies, all debates showed principles, consistency and humility like no other.— Rupert Murdoch(@rupertmurdoch) January 1, 2012
@jack right on"simplify" but easier in startups. My resolutions, try to maintain humility and always curiosity. And of course diet!— Rupert Murdoch(@rupertmurdoch) January 1, 2012
Got to watch Foxnews at 5 EST. Liberal Bob Beckel and team great replacement for Beck and much more fun.— Rupert Murdoch(@rupertmurdoch) January 3, 2012
Can't resist this tweet, but all Iowans think about Rick Santorum.Only candidate with genuine big vision for country.— Rupert Murdoch(@rupertmurdoch) January 3, 2012
While Obama feeling courageous, why not follow his first class education policy. US' absolute biggest crisis. No read, no write, no jobs.— Rupert Murdoch(@rupertmurdoch) January 3, 2012

results.title: The Iowa Caucuses Drinking Game
results.description: If you plan on staying up late and watching coverage of the first-in-the-nation Republican caucus, you're going to need this. Keep these rules and a 12-pack handy as you wade through merciless hours of punditry and spin-doctoring.

results.title: Google Cashes In On Political Cash Flood
results.description: Here's the business card of a guy we met in Des Moines. Sean Harrison is Google's Account Executive for Independent Expenditures and SuperPACs.

results.title: BuzzFeed Exclusive: How Much Did The Republicans Waste On Television Ads In Iowa?
results.description: Rick Perry spent ten times as much on television advertising as did Rick Santorum. Lot of good it did him.

results.title: 40 Young People Around Iowa Share Their American Dream
results.description: For the past few days, I've been carrying around a sketchbook and markers and asking young people at caucus events in Sioux City, Orange City, Rock Rapids, Mason City, Cedar Falls, Des Moines, and Urbandale, Iowa what their idea of the American dream is. Here's what they said.

results.title: How Does One Caucus In Iowa?
results.description: You might have heard that the Republican caucusing process in Iowa is a fairly simple affair when compared to the Democrat version. But is easier better? Take a look at this excellent interactive infographic from the Des Moines Register and decide for yourself.

results.title: In The Drudge Caucus Jon Huntsman Is Even Losing To Herman Cain
results.description: The "Drudge Caucus" polls opened earlier today on the Drudge Report and Jon Huntsman is in dead last. We say "dead" last, because he's even losing to a man who had to drop out of the race in shame due to sexual harassment allegations.

results.title: Rick Santorum's Nephew Endorses Ron Paul, Insults Uncle
results.description: Thanks kid.

results.title: An Inspiring Rick Perry Video That Tells You How Good A Candidate He Might Have Been
results.description: They're hoping Iowans watch this on their iPads and laptops before they caucus tonight. If Rick Perry hadn't turned out to be the Baryshnikov of stepping on his own dick, he could have been a contender.

results.title: Imagine If Ron Paul Was Your Ob/Gyn
results.description: Newsbeast tracked down some of Dr. Paul's patients. And they recall him as kind and capable -- though inclined to talking about the gold standard while they were on the table.

results.title: 10 Pictures Of Workin' Man Mitt Romney
results.description: Workin' Man Mitt is a regular guy, just like you! Mitt Romney's been trying for years to shed the stiff, robotic, and out of touch image that some voters have of him. From the murky depths of Romney's 2002 Massachusetts gubernatorial campaign website, these "work days" photos show his best attempts to relate to the working man.

results.title: The Des Moines Register's Interesting Ad Placement
results.description: With the arrival of the Iowa Caucuses tonight, The Des Moines Register's website will be receiving its quadrennial spike in traffic that accompanies the event. That's why many found it interesting that surrounding the paper's coverage of the Republican caucuses are controversial ads for Barack Obama's campaign.

results.title: Romney Campaign Boasts Of Doing Iowa On The Cheap
results.description: Spending a fraction of what he did in 2008, Romney is poised to have a far better night.

results.title: The Single Saddest Instant Message We Got Tonight
results.description: It's from somebody who works for Rick Perry.
